titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Thomas Frazier receipt to Lucien B. Chase 1977.607
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-12-18 20:22:57 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Thomas Frazier receipt to Lucien B. Chase
did.abstract: An 1881 billing receipt to Lucien B. Chase of Brooklyn from Thomas Frazier for drawing up deeds, bonds and mortgages, as well as tax and title searches for 105 Adelphi Street, where Chase resided and practiced medicine.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Thomas Frazier receipt to Lucien B. Chase, 1881, 1977.607, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A billing receipt to Lucien B. Chase of Brooklyn from Thomas Frazier for drawing up deeds, bonds and mortgages, as well as tax and title searches for 105 Adelphi Street, where Chase resided and practiced medicine. Dated 1881.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
